fields.Title: PLAZA / GASTON
fields.Description: Florid and jolly, Gaston Martin is standing in a sunspot and loudly eating a giant ham sandwich.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""It is what it is, part of life rea..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It is what it is, part of life really," he mumbles, only half-listening to you. "But to know someone for 79 years, then one day they're just *gone*..."

fields.Title: You: ""Tell me.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Tell me."

fields.Title: Physical Instrument: "Of course he didn't, flowers are fo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Of course he didn't, flowers are for pansies. Stop wasting time with them.

fields.Title: You: ""Bye for now." [Leave.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: "Bye for now." [Leave.]

fields.Title: You: ""Icebreaker, I plough through every..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Icebreaker, I plough through every ice sheet on my path."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""You always confused her, couldn't..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You always confused her, couldn't let us be happy..." He says with heavy resentment. "Seduced her with your fancy words and *pastries*."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: "He looks at you for a moment and th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He looks at you for a moment and then speaks quietly. "I took them for myself. Took them to remember that old cunt. Nobody knew him better than I did, and I want to remember that old cunt by something."

fields.Title: Empathy: "He finds comfort in the thought."
fields.Dialogue Text: He finds comfort in the thought.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: "Gaston glumly stares at the shot pu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Gaston glumly stares at the shot put ball. Several seconds pass. Then he speaks: "It's too late now, officer... you got back too late. René is gone."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""The prick survived all the bullets..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The prick survived all the bullets, swords and explosions just to die of a heart attack..." He sighs deeply. "Ironic, isn't it -- even his own bitter little heart couldn't stand him."

fields.Title: You: ""Hey, I said I wouldn't do it, but..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hey, I said I wouldn't do it, but I found you a new *boule*." (Hold out the ball.)

dialogueEntries.conditionsString: Variable["plaza.rene_refused_boule"] == true  and  CheckItem("shotput_ball")  and  Variable["TASK.get_petanquista_new_boule_done"] == false  and  Variable["plaza.rene_know_dead"] == true

fields.Title: You: ""It really wasn't bad.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "It really wasn't bad."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: "He stares at you, aghast. "What a w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He stares at you, aghast. "What a waste..."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""I don't mean to keep Gaston's tong..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't mean to keep Gaston's tongue from your rectum, officer, but do you actually have any *police* business with us?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Ugh... thank you, officer." He loo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ugh... thank you, officer." He looks at you with disgust. "Please tell me there wasn't anything else?"

fields.Title: You: "(Whisper.) "Kim, cheating in sports..."
fields.Dialogue Text: (Whisper.) "Kim, cheating in sports is *unacceptable*. I got this."

fields.Title: Reaction Speed: "A glimmer of respect flashes in Ren..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A glimmer of respect flashes in René's eyes.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "He will never play pétanque again."
fields.Dialogue Text: He will never play pétanque again.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""René and I were both by her bedsid..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "René and I were both by her bedside when she..." He pauses, searching for the right word.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Died," he sharply fills the silenc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Died," he sharply fills the silence and adds: "No use sugar-coating it. Won't bring her back, will it now?"

fields.Title: You: ""Why do you think she was indecisiv..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Why do you think she was indecisive?"

fields.Title: You: ""That's a bit odd.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's a bit odd."

fields.Title: You: ""I offer my sincere condolences." (..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I offer my sincere condolences." (Conclude.)

fields.Title: You: ""I suggest naming it 'Gaston's Shit..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I suggest naming it 'Gaston's Shit Sandwich', that's what I think."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""FUCK OFF, it's mine!" He jerks awa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "FUCK OFF, it's mine!" He jerks away, immediately startled by his own reaction.

fields.Title: Perception (Sight): "The sandwich looks like a culinary..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The sandwich looks like a culinary wonder, well made and abundant in components. The author sure knew their craft.

fields.Title: Reaction Speed: "... and it's gone."
fields.Dialogue Text: ... and it's gone.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""We knew her, alright..." His frien..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "We knew her, alright..." His friendly face lights up. "Lived on the same street our entire lives, just two houses apart. The three of us have been best friends since we were four."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""We were just boys, then. This was..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "We were just boys, then. This was different. *You*..." The tall veteran looks at you and nods.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""No point starting this all over ag..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No point starting this all over again, for the thousandth and the first time. Especially when we have company." He turns to you: "Officer?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Guess he was about to head home, '..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Guess he was about to head home, 'cause when the dockworkers found him he was wearing civilian clothes and not the cockatoo uniform I saw him in all the time."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Well, you took one of them." He sh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Well, you took one of them." He shakes his head. "Still can't believe he gave it to you, but that's how rigid he was. Once the offer carelessly left his lips it was irrefutable..."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Maybe it's time to slow down, enjo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Maybe it's time to slow down, enjoy life a bit?" He smiles apologetically. "Anything I can do to assist you?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I guess it doesn't really matter a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I guess it doesn't really matter anymore. You do what you have to, like the rest of us... So how can I help?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh, okay..." He seems to edge away..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh, okay..." He seems to edge away from you. "It's perfectly alright. No harm done and it's really none of my business anyway."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""No," he replies quickly. "René was..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No," he replies quickly. "René was the most stubborn man in Revachol. Nothing you or I could say would ever *push* him to do anything. The man was completely immovable."

fields.Title: You: ""You're right, that's none of our b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You're right, that's none of our business."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That was nice," the lieutenant smi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That was nice," the lieutenant smiles. "A small thing for us, but invaluable to him. He probably didn't even know René had the photo."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I just don't know anymore... about..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I just don't know anymore... about anything really." He slowly shakes his head, then remembers your presence. "But you... you must need something?"

fields.Title: You: ""Wait, Insulindian Lillies?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Wait, Insulindian Lillies?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I have really outdone myself..." H..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I have really outdone myself..." He takes a bite out of his sandwich. "This is divine."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""It... isn't right." The old man do..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It... isn't right." The old man doesn't even bother looking away. "René wanted to be buried in his uniform. But I guess it doesn't matter now..."

fields.Title: Logic: "You're not gonna get anything out o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You're not gonna get anything out of this guy. If the old carabineer knew something, it will be buried with him.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Gaston Martin: ""Let me think..." He looks at the c..."]
You: ""So you both know her?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "So you both know her?"

fields.Title: You: ""Sorry, but I *really* wanted to ju..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Sorry, but I *really* wanted to just ask some questions."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Heck," he says with a chuckle. "*T..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Heck," he says with a chuckle. "*Technically* we're both still engaged to her."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Of course, officer," he says with..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Of course, officer," he says with a smile. "Memories are all we have left."

fields.Title: You: ""Something mean?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Something mean?"

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Host almighty, he's a total bummer..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Host almighty, he's a total bummer now!

fields.Title: You: ""The fuel oil was an environmental..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The fuel oil was an environmental hazard. I had to get rid of it somehow."

fields.Title: You: ""Do you think our conversation abou..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Do you think our conversation about his job pushed him to go out there?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I'm sorry, officer, I just..." He..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm sorry, officer, I just..." He dries his eyes. "Thank you, *thank you* for this little memorabilia. It really means the world to me."

fields.Title: You: ""I'm not afraid of dying -- I'm onl..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm not afraid of dying -- I'm only afraid of not really living."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Yes?" he looks up. "What about, Re..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes?" he looks up. "What about, René?"

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "But you feel the dried flower in yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: But you feel the dried flower in your hand somehow still *does* matter. Although not to this sad old man.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""It is such a pleasure to see you a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It is such a pleasure to see you again, officer. How may I aid the Citizens Militia on this fine day?"

fields.Title: You: ""Tell me, what do you know about th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Tell me, what do you know about the dead man?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Life... *mnjam-mnjam*... doesn't n..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Life... *mnjam-mnjam*... doesn't need to be a struggle." He covers his mouth to hide a burp.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Gaston Martin: ""What do you mean, officer?" He loo..."]
Gaston Martin: ""Departed," his partner finishes hi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Departed," his partner finishes his sentence, then chuckles: "Until the very end she couldn't decide between us. The most indecisive woman I've ever met."

fields.Title: Composure: "He is trying to retain his jolly fa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He is trying to retain his jolly façade, but the underlying sadness casts a deep shadow over his wrinkled face.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I repeat -- an *absolute* cunt." H..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I repeat -- an *absolute* cunt." He turns to look at the crater. "Even his old army buddies didn't want him around. He was like an old viper."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh... sorry, officer... What do yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh... sorry, officer... What do you want?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh..." He doesn't look up. "Good...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh..." He doesn't look up. "Good. Good for you, officer. I'm just wondering if René ever... never mind. Can I help you with something?"

fields.Title: Reaction Speed: "Wait... did he push himself to prov..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Wait... did he push himself to prove he can pull his weight and doesn't need hand-outs?

fields.Title: Perception (Smell): "And *then* it hits you -- the brill..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And *then* it hits you -- the brilliant bastard has drenched the entire sandwich in honey mustard. That's incredibly decadent. And delicious.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Sweet sweet Jeannie..." He nods, s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Sweet sweet Jeannie..." He nods, smiling. "Ask away officer, I knew her all my life."

fields.Title: You: ""Why didn't he like them?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Why didn't he like them?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""She died of pneumonia two winters..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "She died of pneumonia two winters ago. It was a quiet passage. Peaceful." He smiles faintly.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""She was always leaving one of us f..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "She was always leaving one of us for the other, but never long enough to actually get married."

fields.Title: You: ""Was he really that bad?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Was he really that bad?"

fields.Title: You: ""How did he die exactly?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "How did he die exactly?"

fields.Title: You: ""Looks delicious." (Point to the sa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Looks delicious." (Point to the sandwich.) "Can I have a bite of that?"

dialogueEntries.conditionsString: Variable["plaza.gaston_got_the_sandwich"] == false  and  Variable["plaza.gaston_rhetoric_white"] == false  and  Variable["plaza.gaston_kept_sandwich"] == false  and  Variable["plaza.gaston_kitsuragi_kept_sandwich"] == false  and  CheckItem("ham_sandwich") == false  and  (Variable["plaza.gaston_altgreet_rene_dead"] == false  or  Variable["plaza.rene_know_dead"] == false)

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "You can barely hear him. The sweet..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You can barely hear him. The sweet smell of pickles in harmony with garlic butter and marinated onions emanating from the sandwich is driving your mind in a singular direction -- it must be yours.

fields.Title: You: ""Firewalker. I walk in the flames.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Firewalker. I walk in the flames."

fields.Title: You: ""The irony isn't lost on me, but I..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The irony isn't lost on me, but I wanted to ask about something else."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Gaston Martin: ""What do you mean, officer?" He loo..."]
Jump to: [Empathy: "Despite their differences these men..."]
You: ""Nothing wrong with weighing your o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Nothing wrong with weighing your options first."

fields.Title: You: ""Shame, I didn't get to ask him how..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Shame, I didn't get to ask him how to turn back time."

dialogueEntries.conditionsString: Variable["plaza.rene_fascha_dream_endurance_confirmed"] == true  and  Variable["plaza.gaston_fascha_dq_rene_dead_aske_him"] == false  and  Variable["plaza.rene_asked_about_turning_back_time"] == false  and  Variable["plaza.gaston_rene_was_an_absolute_cunt"] == true

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""She was René's first girl, back wh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "She was René's first girl, back when the prick was sixteen." He looks at the carabineer almost gently. "They were courting till he decided he'd rather die for some great *idéal* than just be hap---"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh, officer..." Gaston is unfazed..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh, officer..." Gaston is unfazed by the outburst. "It already got ugly nearly eighty years ago when the three of us were just learning to walk and talk."

fields.Title: Pain Threshold: "A quick grimace of pain passes over..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A quick grimace of pain passes over René's features, but he immediately regains control. His face now a dispassionate mask again.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""We all got to go some time, office..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "We all got to go some time, officer. Everyone I love is already there. Probably waiting for me." He smiles faintly. "I'm not afraid to die. It's been a good run and I really miss my friends..."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Apocalypse?" He backs away, visibl..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Apocalypse?" He backs away, visibly worried. "I uh... I don't know, what this means, officer. I'm sorry. But thank you! I'm here to cooperate any way I can."

fields.Title: You: ""Please, man, can I just have a bit..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Please, man, can I just have a bite?"

fields.Title: Logic: "Did he feel like he *has* to prove..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Did he feel like he *has* to prove he can still pull his weight? Doesn't need hand-outs?

fields.Title: You: ""I want to go over few more things..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I want to go over few more things about René, if that's okay?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant gives you a long, sl..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant gives you a long, slow shake of his head.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""She could never make up her mind a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "She could never make up her mind about anything. What to have for breakfast, favourite colour or which one of us to marry." The look in his eyes is happy and distant.

fields.Title: You: ""Some right-wing royalist slogan?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Some right-wing royalist slogan?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""'In Guillaume's time you'd have be..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "'In Guillaume's time you'd have been shot without a trial'. That's what he said to me." The old man gathers himself and wipes his eyes again. "He lived a cunt and he died a cunt. Let's leave it at that."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Yes, yes... and the taste?" He lea..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, yes... and the taste?" He leans even closer. "How was the taste?"

fields.Title: You: ""Taste? I just ate it, forgot to ch..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Taste? I just ate it, forgot to check the taste."

fields.Title: You: ""*Please*, friend, let's just share..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "*Please*, friend, let's just share it."

fields.Title: Physical Instrument: "Doesn't matter?! Integrity in sport..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Doesn't matter?! Integrity in sports *doesn't matter*?! Hold me back, sonny-Jim... GODDAMNIT, it's *all* that matters!!!

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: "The old man stares at the flower, t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The old man stares at the flower, then sighs and says: "René wasn't really what you'd call a botanist, officer. And believe me, he didn't like Insulindian Lilies."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I uh..." He rubs his chin, not kno..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I uh..." He rubs his chin, not knowing what to say. "That's nice. Uh... If I'm in your way, I'll move! Or can I help in any way?"

fields.Title: Jump to: [Gaston Martin: ""Oh? The goal is to throw your *bou..."]
René Arnoux: "He suddenly remembers *you* are sti..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He suddenly remembers *you* are still there, falls silent, and turns away.

fields.Title: You: ""Gone? Gone where?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Gone? Gone where?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Yes. I... I loved that angry prick..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes. I... I loved that angry prick. He didn't deserve it, but I did." He wipes his eyes with a sleeve. "You know what his last words to me were?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes." The lieutenant nods. "We are..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes." The lieutenant nods. "We are both very sorry for your loss."

fields.Title: You: ""I wanted to ask you about the Unio..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I wanted to ask you about the Union again."

fields.Title: You: ""Okay... I'm not that hungry anyway.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay... I'm not that hungry anyway."

fields.Title: Reaction Speed: "That means the uniform could still..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That means the uniform could still be in the guard booth -- something to keep in mind if you *really* plan to give yourself to Revachol.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Guess he was about to head home. T..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Guess he was about to head home. The dockworkers found him in his civilian clothes and not the cockatoo uniform you... ugh... confiscated."

fields.Title: You: ""Where is René?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Where is René?"

dialogueEntries.conditionsString: IsDayFrom(5)  and  Variable["plaza.rene_know_dead"] == false  and  Variable["plaza.gaston_rene_was_an_absolute_cunt"] == false

fields.Title: You: ""Sounds like this is between you tw..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Sounds like this is between you two. I have other matters to address."

fields.Title: You: "Do not intervene."
fields.Dialogue Text: Do not intervene.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Ghost of the past." The old man re..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ghost of the past." The old man removes his hat and sea wind ruffles his grey hair. "Everyone in this story is already dead, officer. I don't wanna talk about them."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Uh... *everything* really. I proba..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Uh... *everything* really. I probably knew him better than..." He stops, realizing something. "You meant the teacup in the tree, didn't you? I don't know anything about him."

fields.Title: You: ""It was (*burp*) great! Nutritious..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It was (*burp*) great! Nutritious as fuck! I could go all night on one of these pocket rockets!"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I guess you don't really need tast..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I guess you don't really need taste buds for police work." He looks disappointed. "Is there anything else, officer?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""The only one you have.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "The only one you have."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh..." He glances at the burnt wri..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh..." He glances at the burnt writing. "Of course. I didn't think of it. Good job officer!"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I'm glad to assist you if I can, o..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm glad to assist you if I can, officer," he replies, voice tired and breaking.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Let me see..." Gaston takes the ph..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Let me see..." Gaston takes the photo, hands trembling. "This was 60 years ago! We all went to that parade. Young René looks so happy and Jeannie..." Eyes blurry with tears, he has to stop.

fields.Title: Empathy: "Despite their differences these men..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Despite their differences these men played such a significant part in each other's lives that now that one of them is gone, the other feels... just lost.

fields.Title: You: ""I don't want to die.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't want to die."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Hello, officer." He turns to you...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hello, officer." He turns to you. "How might I be of assistance on this fine day?"

fields.Title: You: ""Hey, Gaston. No comment on the dud..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hey, Gaston. No comment on the duds?"

fields.Title: You: ""You mentioned Jeanne-Marie Beaulie..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You mentioned Jeanne-Marie Beaulieu. Who is that?"

fields.Title: You: ""What happened to her?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What happened to her?"

fields.Title: Perception (Sight): "In addition to the obvious slice of..."
fields.Dialogue Text: In addition to the obvious slice of ham -- a fat one -- you notice a brim of a tomato peeking from below. And... is that mayonnaise?

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Aeons ago. Probably when you were s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Aeons ago. Probably when you were still a child.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""It is what it is... part of life,"..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It is what it is... part of life," he mumbles, only half-listening to you. "But to know someone for 79 years, then one day they're just *gone*..."

fields.Title: You: ""I'm not afraid of death either.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm not afraid of death either."

fields.Title: You: ""What are the rules of this game?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What are the rules of this game?"

dialogueEntries.conditionsString: Variable["plaza.rene_be_the_ball"] == false  and  Variable["plaza.gaston_altgreet_rene_dead"] == false  and  Variable["plaza.rene_know_dead"] == false  and  Variable["plaza.gaston_heard_enough_about_petanque"] == false

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""*Mon dieu*, officer!" He looks at..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "*Mon dieu*, officer!" He looks at your wounds. "It is worse than I thought! Believe me, I know all about that kind of pain, I've had hip trouble for the past... week."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: "His voice trembles. "...a-and she n..."
fields.Dialogue Text: His voice trembles. "...a-and she never lost sight of it. And I thought if the most beautiful being in the world can love him, then there must be something worth holding on to..."

fields.Title: You: ""It was over so quickly I didn't ge..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It was over so quickly I didn't get a chance to form an opinion."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Actually never mind... Wouldn't be..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Actually never mind... Wouldn't be the same..."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Well... technically *you* stole he..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Well... technically *you* stole her from *me*, because we'd been pretty close ever since you two had that falling out over the ink you spilled over her pretty yellow dress..."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""The prick is gone," he replies, tr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The prick is gone," he replies, trying to smile. "I... I can barely believe it, but he's really gone."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Well, officer, what did you think?..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Well, officer, what did you think?" The jolly man leans forward, excited to hear your opinion.

fields.Title: You: ""You're not hearing me, man. I *nee..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You're not hearing me, man. I *need* the sandwich!"

fields.Title: You: ""I'm obliged by the law to tell you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm obliged by the law to tell you there's been a breach of *ethics*." (Wink and point to the balls.)

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh, uh... Well thank you, officer...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh, uh... Well thank you, officer. It certainly lightened the mood." He laughs nervously. "Very cosy, like a little street fair almost."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""What is... actually never mind." H..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What is... actually never mind." He smiles a clever smile "I'm sure there's *something* I can help you with, officer."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "Teacup? Oh, because of the ceramic..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Teacup? Oh, because of the ceramic armour. Clever.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Do not *defile* her memory, Gaston..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Do not *defile* her memory, Gaston." There's an almost imperceptibly small tremble in his voice. "Let her rest in peace."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""You stole her from me," René repea..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You stole her from me," René repeats, trying to steady his breathing and still clutching his chest.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Officer..." he looks up, all wrink..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Officer..." he looks up, all wrinkled, old and small. "I just can't do this right now. The Union... it just doesn't matter anymore."

fields.Title: You: ""It was a sandwich, I don't know wh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It was a sandwich, I don't know what to tell you. I was hungry and now I'm not."

fields.Title: You: ""That he's sorry?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "That he's sorry?"

fields.Title: You: ""I'm pretty much on my wait out mys..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm pretty much on my wait out myself too... can't wait to die!"

fields.Title: Jump to: [Gaston Martin: ""Oh... sorry, officer... What do yo..."]
Gaston Martin: ""This... this isn't right, officer...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "This... this isn't right, officer." He shakes his head. "René wanted to be buried in his uniform, but..."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Officer..." The jolliness is gone..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Officer..." The jolliness is gone from Gaston's face. "Care to play a game with a lonely old man?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh, sweet Jeannie..." He gets a dr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh, sweet Jeannie..." He gets a dreamy look in his eyes. "She was the finest woman in all of Revachol. Maybe the entire world."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Sure, officer." He nods. "It's bet..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Sure, officer." He nods. "It's better for  René's flickering ticker too. Not that he'd ever admit anything there needs tinkering."

fields.Title: You: ""Do you know what happened to his m..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Do you know what happened to his medals?"

fields.Title: You: ""Policeman of the state yet to come.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Policeman of the state yet to come."

fields.Title: You: ""Very nourishing. Thank you!""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Very nourishing. Thank you!"

fields.Title: Reaction Speed: "'Do or die -- there is no middle gr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: 'Do or die -- there is no middle ground' -- that's what you told René. Perhaps he wasn't *completely* immovable after all?

fields.Title: You: ""Something forgettable, like 'See y..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Something forgettable, like 'See you tomorrow' probably?"

fields.Title: You: ""Let's talk some more about Jeanne-..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Let's talk some more about Jeanne-Marie."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Sure, officer." He smiles. "They a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Sure, officer." He smiles. "They are the good guys around here. What do you need?"

fields.Title: You: ""What? Was he killed during the mer..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What? Was he killed during the mercenary tribunal?"

fields.Title: You: ""Too bad René's gone, I was hoping..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Too bad René's gone, I was hoping to ask him about May bells..." (Hold out the flower.)

dialogueEntries.conditionsString: Variable["plaza.gaston_rene_was_an_absolute_cunt"] == true  and  CheckItem("dried_may_bells")  and  Variable["plaza.gaston_maybells_asked"] == false

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I guess in the end the Insulindian..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I guess in the end the Insulindian Lillies were just another piece of the Old Insulinde, the royalists had to surrender to the Mazovian insurgents. It doesn't really matter anymore."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Officer!" He exclaims. "The mere s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Officer!" He exclaims. "The mere sight of police in Martinaise makes me feel safer already. How can I help you?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Yes, that's what you need, Gaston...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, that's what you need, Gaston. More padding on that fat ass of yours. I hope your heart gives out."

fields.Title: Endurance: "No worries, just a small setback. *..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No worries, just a small setback. *Movere tempore*, kingsman. For the tenacious no road is impassable. Just got to stay moving.

fields.Title: You: ""Did you love him?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Did you love him?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: "Gaston sighs and mumbles, more to h..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Gaston sighs and mumbles, more to himself than you: "Hell, most likely. He was an absolute cunt..."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""*Mon dieu*, you set it on fire!" H..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "*Mon dieu*, you set it on fire!" He looks at the plaza. "What kind of a policeman are you?"

fields.Title: You: ""Truly a masterpiece of modern gast..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Truly a masterpiece of modern gastronomy. Or should I say... *GASTONomy*." (Give the man an approving wink.)

fields.Title: You: ""*Very* nourishing indeed." (Rub yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "*Very* nourishing indeed." (Rub your belly.)

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""When the dissidents come to *rape*..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "When the dissidents come to *rape* our country, he hides, but try to get a bite of his dear sandwich and he gets claws? You're a special kind of a vermin, Gaston."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Sorry, officer, I'm sorry, I didn'..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Sorry, officer, I'm sorry, I didn't mean it in a bad way," he continues cautiously. "But the sandwich is mine, I'm not gonna share it."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Believe me, officer, I wish I coul..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Believe me, officer, I wish I could help you, but I need this sandwich to keep my blood sugar stable." He's squirming, avoiding your gaze. "In my age you need to pay attention to these things."

fields.Title: You: ""Don't be a dick, Gaston, there's p..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Don't be a dick, Gaston, there's plenty for everyone."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh, that's good, that's very good...."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh, that's good, that's very good." He's visibly relieved. "You must have other business then?"

fields.Title: Empathy: "He has doubts, but right now he jus..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He has doubts, but right now he just wants to move on and not think about it.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We are both very sorry for your lo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "We are both very sorry for your loss," the lieutenant bows his head. "Death of a friend is a terrible thing."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh, he would have liked that." The..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh, he would have liked that." The old man slowly shakes his head. "Violent lives ending violently... That's how he wanted to go. Sadly it was not the case."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""AND THEN YOU STOLE HER FROM ME!" H..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "AND THEN YOU STOLE HER FROM ME!" He jerks forward, but then grabs his chest and stops.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""We've hated each other our entire..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "We've hated each other our entire lives. So much in fact that..." He falls silent and looks at you, eyes filling up with tears.

fields.Title: You: ""Women, right?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Women, right?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""His angry little heart finally gav..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "His angry little heart finally gave out." He sighs. "The dockworkers found him in the guard booth this morning. Wasn't even supposed to be working for another week, but he just had to prove how tough he is..."

fields.Title: You: ""Hey, Gaston, I found you a new *bo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Hey, Gaston, I found you a new *boule*." (Hold out the ball.)

dialogueEntries.conditionsString: Variable["TASK.get_petanquista_new_boule"] == true  and  CheckItem("shotput_ball")  and  Variable["TASK.get_petanquista_new_boule_done"] == false  and  (Variable["plaza.gaston_altgreet_rene_dead"] == true  or  Variable["plaza.rene_know_dead"] == true)

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Keep it, it's not even a real *bou..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Keep it, it's not even a real *boule*." He waves you away. "Besides, it doesn't really matter now. I've never seen anyone else play pétanque in Martinaise."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Mhmh," he replies with a slight no..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Mhmh," he replies with a slight nod. "That's their old name, dating back to the time of kings and crests and all that other stuff he loved so much."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I'll be with you in a moment, offi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'll be with you in a moment, officer. Let me just finish my sandwich." He nods to his partner. "Talk to angry old René first."

fields.Title: Authority: "His tone lacks its usual intensity,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: His tone lacks its usual intensity, like he doesn't feel he has the right to speak on the matter.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""It's okay, officer." He smooths hi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's okay, officer." He smooths his white whiskers. "You might have just saved René from a heart attack."

fields.Title: You: ""Old people die, you better get rea..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Old people die, you better get ready too." (Conclude.)

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Sometimes I thought he was wearing..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Sometimes I thought he was wearing it just to piss me off." Gaston smiles a sad smile. "Now the joke's on him, 'cause he's gonna be buried without it."
fields.Alternate1: "Sometimes I thought he was wearing it just to piss me off." Gaston stares at the uniform you're wearing. "Guess the joke's on him now. Won't even be buried in it."
fields.Alternate2: "Sometimes I thought he was wearing it just to piss me off." Gaston stares at your jacket. "Guess the joke's on him now. Won't even be buried in it."
fields.Alternate3: "Sometimes I thought he was wearing it just to piss me off." Gaston stares at your pants. "Guess the joke's on him now. Won't even be buried in it."

fields.Title: You: ""I uh... don't know. It was an acci..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I uh... don't know. It was an accident. I'm sorry."

fields.Title: You: ""The herald of the apocalypse.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "The herald of the apocalypse."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Yes..." A strange expression runs..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes..." A strange expression runs across his wrinkled face, then vanishes without trace.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""But you probably had some official..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "But you probably had some official business too?" he asks and puts the hat back on.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh, okay..." He seems to edge away..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh, okay..." He seems to edge away from you. "Well *I* certainly have full confidence in your competence. And the future," he adds quickly.

fields.Title: You: ""A beacon of light in the dull shor..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "A beacon of light in the dull shores of mediocrity. You're welcome, Martinaise."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, you are not. Enforcing proper..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No, you are not. Enforcing proper conduct in an amateur pétanque game is not something the RCM involves itself in." He smiles. "It doesn't matter."

fields.Title: You: ""Here, something to remember your f..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Here, something to remember your friend by..." (Give him the photograph of René and the girl.)
fields.Alternate1: "Here, something to remember your friends by..." (Give him the photograph of René and the girl.)

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""There were many reasons, but mostl..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "There were many reasons, but mostly it was the communards. They called them 'The Bells of Revolution'." A sad smile passes his face.

fields.Title: You: "Convince Gaston to relinquish his s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Convince Gaston to relinquish his sandwich.
fields.tooltip6: Drafted him into a vigilante group.

dialogueEntries.conditionsString: Variable["plaza.gaston_rhetoric_white"] == true  and  CheckItem("ham_sandwich") == false  and  (Variable["plaza.gaston_altgreet_rene_dead"] == false  or  Variable["plaza.rene_know_dead"] == false)

fields.Title: You: ""May René rest in peace." (Conclude..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "May René rest in peace." (Conclude.)

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Real shame..." The old man nods, e..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Real shame..." The old man nods, eyes still on the ground. He's not really paying attention to your words.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""The other one I took for myself."..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The other one I took for myself." He looks at you defiantly. "No one knew him better than I did, and I want to remember that old cunt by something."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I uh..." He rubs his chin, not kno..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I uh..." He rubs his chin, not knowing what to say. "That's nice. Uh... better somehow. Can I help in any way?"

fields.Title: Endurance: "Suddenly you realize how hungry you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Suddenly you realize how hungry you are. The last time you ate must have been... god knows when.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""René, tsk-tsk. It's the little ple..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "René, tsk-tsk. It's the little pleasures. Life doesn't need to be a.... *mnjam mnjam*... a struggle."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Yes..." A strange expression runs..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes..." A strange expression runs across his wrinkled face, when he repeats: "in peace."

fields.Title: You: ""Easy fellows, no need for this to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Easy fellows, no need for this to get ugly."

fields.Title: You: ""Thanks for sharing." (Conclude.)"
fields.Dialogue Text: "Thanks for sharing." (Conclude.)

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "Strange how  *old cunt* sounds almo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Strange how  *old cunt* sounds almost gentle when he says it now.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""The only people who could stand to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The only people who could stand to be around him were Jeannie and me..." He pauses. "She saw something in him when we were just kids, and..."

fields.Title: You: ""I ate your sandwich, Gaston.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I ate your sandwich, Gaston."

dialogueEntries.conditionsString: Variable["plaza.gaston_altgreet_rene_dead"] == false  and  Variable["inventory.sandwich_told_gaston_your_opinion"] == false  and  (Variable["inventory.sandwich_appreciated_the_taste"] == true  or  Variable["inventory.sandwich_wolfed_it_down"] == true)

fields.Title: Drama: "Make it... *lively*!"
fields.Dialogue Text: Make it... *lively*!

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Coming from an officer of the law,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Coming from an officer of the law, this appraisal means an awful lot to me." He bows slightly. "Thank you."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I'm sorry, officer, but I really d..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm sorry, officer, but I really don't share food," he says and quickly adds: "Nothing personal, it's just a principle."
